intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium murorum subsp. semisilvularum, commonly known as the woodland hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-yellow flowering heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly more compact growth habit compared to other members of the species.
